intro: Hornstedtia pininga var. pininga, commonly known as the Pininga hornstedtia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
